title: Real life lessons you can learn from playing League
body:
League: CSing is important.
IRL: Patience and hard work often pays off later, even though you may not see the benefit right away.

League: Take objectives.
IRL: Have a vision and go for what's important.

League: Make decisions. It's better to make a half-decent decision than to make no decisions.
IRL: same

League: Respect your enemy's zone.
IRL: Respect people's boundaries.

League: Don't go into enemy's unwarded jungle alone.
IRL: Do your research before you try something new.

League: Be a dick, get banned.
IRL: Actions have consequences.
[Source](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/EYM4T36I-real-life-lessons-you-can-learn-from-playing-league?comment=0000)

League: The support role is a valuable asset to the team, not just some fill position.
IRL: Behind most strong leaders is people backing them up. Teamwork, bitches.
[Source](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/EYM4T36I-real-life-lessons-you-can-learn-from-playing-league?comment=0005)

League: Some people are assholes.
IRL: same
[Source](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/EYM4T36I-real-life-lessons-you-can-learn-from-playing-league?comment=0001)

League: 

Share your own, and I'll add to the list!
(The reason I'm making this list is so that I can make excuses when people ask "why do you play League it's such a waste of time")

replies.body: This:
that is bot lane feeding...

Their bot lane:Batman and Superman
Our bot lane: Beavis and Butthead
Or it's freaking {{champion:67}} diving again and the poor support is basically soloing the lane with 2 fed enemies.

League: Some people are assholes.
IRL: Some people are assholes.

XD
the truth

League: people sometimes make stupid decisions and blame the team
IRL: trust no person during a group project

...that was a joke in case it turned out to be overly rude.

joke but true O.O
that was me in highschool.  The 1% doing 99%
You were in a group of 100?

no i am one of those people who gets shoved in a group and everyone stands around with their thumbs in their noses while i write an essay and do the research.  Not always, but usually, i do most of the work

**League:**: When a team works together by communicating and being on the same page, they'll be more successful. 
**IRL**: Same. This can apply to various situations, both at work and in your personal life.

**League**: Build people up rather than tearing them down. Encouragement and positive words go a long way.
**IRL** Same.

League: You can't 1v5.
IRL: Don't be afraid to ask for help.

> League: Be a dick, get banned.
> IRL: Actions have consequences.

Donald trump has millions of dollars. 
Millionaires make money off sweat shop workers. 
This isn't even remotely true.
I don't think any of us are multi-millionaires...
Speak for yourself

League: You may have the best abilities, but the fed champion with loads of gold will likely win
IRL: Having talent and creativity not always means success, sometimes you need power and money

League: The support role is a valuable asset to the team, not just some fill position.
IRL: Behind most strong leaders is people backing them up. Teamwork, bitches.

Real talk: being a support main in League was a huge eye-opener for me in terms of figuring out what kind of person I want to be in the real world. It gave me a perfect framework for realizing that I don't actually want to be the guy who accomplishes something amazing, I want to be the guy standing right behind that guy saying, "Yeah, you did it, and I helped." Which is not exactly what people tell you that you should aspire to be most of the time :/

League: Before we start any given match, we accept the risk of losing/having a bad game, because the potential for a rewarding experience out-weighs the risk.
IRL: Before we start any given match (ie we take on a human form) we exist in state of nothingness, of infinite pure bliss, peace and unity. But that gets boring, so we decided to come play this human game, because taking on risks equals potential rewards. We CHOSE to be here, and we must never forget that fact. The only logical response to life, with all its glorious suffering, pain and conflict (AND happiness and love), is GRATITUDE THAT WE GET TO PLAY THIS GAME :)

League: If you call a specific role in champ select, say bot lane support, stick to your chosen role/position. You're VERY unlikely to succeed, and/or let your whole team down, if you suddenly decide you want to take a support champ {{champion:16}} with supp items/runes/masteries into the jungle.
IRL: Don't be surprised when you suffer because you're trying to be something you're not.
That philosophy lesson though O.o
DEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEP.... {{champion:111}}

League: sometimes you are forced to play with incompetent, rude jerks 

IRL, in the workplace: sometimes you are forced to work with incompetent, rude jerks
carry 6 different type of swords

League: And sometimes a bow.
IRL: Diversify your portfolio.

League: Don't chase {{champion:27}} 

IRL: Don't chase {{champion:27}}
Wait. Where is he?  I need to meet him

If you don't know where he is, don't go wandering through the unknown. Know the risks. 

EDIT: 
League: Don't chase Singed. 
IRL: Pursue your goals, but know the risks in doing so.

Life Lesson: People will generally look at what you could be doing to make up for their mistakes instead of what they could be doing better.

League: Community

IRL: Life is full of disappointments

It's almost as if league was a game created in real life
Woah...

League: All women are crazy and want to kill you/take your soul away/burn you/spear you/shot you/ and do bad things to you in general.
IRL: Same.

**League: **The team that initiates the teamfight is usually the one to win it.
**Life Lesson:** In order to get where you want to go, you have to be willing to move.
If you don't get wat u want, you afk and leave.

This reminds me of Arkadian's Tips for bronze and gold... It's like you directly quoted him.

I have one:

League Of Legends: Getting a penta as {{champion:16}} feels amazing
IRL: Even if you're not meant to do something, doing it anyway is awesome if it helps regardless and you're meant to be incapable of doing so.
I watch those series too! I did copy some of those tips, like the part about making decisions, but I didn't reference the series because the tip itself seemed pretty general.

League: Have self-control so that when you die or lose an objective, you don't go on tilt.
IRL: Control your emotions, so that you can rationally think through tough situations.

League: Mute people who are toxic so that they don't affect your gameplay.
IRL: Cut the toxic people out of your life so you can live happily without them bogging you down.

League: People think they are always right
IRL: People think they are always right
How to deal with people who just want to make your life miserable.

There's a time and place for everything.

The time you want to push mid may be better spent getting dragon/baron etc.

Goodluck in your list ^_^

League: Be a dick, get banned.
IRL: Actions have consequences.

League: playing champion to know their weaknness is best way to defeating them and gives you good foundation for marcomanagement.
IRL: Being able to think from others people perspectives gives you power over them and may make you a good leader.


League: irrationally getting blamed for not helping
IRL: people tend to think their problems are also problems of others.

League: Off meta can work
IRL: Try new things

Lessons:
Get off the internet
You're always right
Complainers need therapy and pills, not games
Tuning people out or physically impaling them does wonders

League: Never surrender, never give up because there's always hope.

IRL: Same.

League: No matter where you are how good you think you are, there's always room for improvement
IRL: Same

League: ask for ganks
IRL: don't be afraid to ask for help

League: not everyone will gank for you for many reasons.
IRL: you can't get help for everything./not everyone will help you. (ask anyway)

League: You only need 1 boot to go faster
IRL: You only need 1 boo.....wait...nvm

Well I think all your points are garbage and have no transference to real life.

One that does is reaction to trolls and just generally unpleasant people. I find I've dealt with them so much, when I see them in real life I can't even get angry at them. I don't try and have pissing contests with people taking a shit anymore. I recognize the futility and don't even say anything most of the time.

Now onto the one I find is something should learn whether or not they play league. That is Correcting your mistakes and willingness to accept criticism. This is something that the majority of people and league players even more so don't have. THink about a situation and think of what the best possible out come is. I applied this to social situations and I feel I became much better at socializing because of it. Doing this also makes you more open to criticsm. How this applies to league is when something doesn't go well just think of how you could have done better. I actually got better faster than I could win games and climb, so I went from p5-d5 with a 70% winrate.
